alert.note: Alert for Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 7:12AM CDT until further notice by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, McDonald and Newton. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 710 AM CDT, Between 2 and 4 inches of rain fell across the warned area between Thursday afternoon and early this morning, leading to widespread flooding. - This includes the following low water crossings... Butler Creek at Kings Highway, Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road, North Indian Creek at Orchid Drive, Hickory Creek at Coler RD, Elkhorn Creek at Highway CC, Buffalo Creek at Klondike Road and Shoal Creek at Farm Road 2110. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
